hints.title: Composition of LSI Operators (Reference)
hints.content:
278: :label: thm-composition-reference
279: 
280: If $\Psi_1$ and $\Psi_2$ are Markov operators on $\mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ satisfying:
281: 
282: 1. $D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_1 \# \mu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \alpha_1 \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_1$
283: 2. $D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_2 \# \nu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \alpha_2 \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi) + C_2$
284: 
285: Then the composition $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_2 \circ \Psi_1$ satisfies:
286: 
287: $$
288: D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_{\text{total}} \# \mu \| \pi) \leq [1 - \tau(\alpha_1 + \alpha_2)] D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_1 + C_2 + O(\tau^2)
289: $$
290: 
291: **Proof**: See Theorem 6.3 (Composition Theorem, lines 1148-1215) of [10_kl_convergence.md](10_kl_convergence.md).
